title: Magdalena Lederbauer
text:
e-mail
  

  
  
Welcome to my personal website! See [CV] for my academic CV, here is a short listing. I love to work on science and extracurricular projects, see my Portfolio for details. Happy to get in touch on social media (LinkedIn, X, e-mail).

title: Magdalena Lederbauer
text:
What‚Äôs New

[24/10] I joined the Massachusetts Institute of Technology for my master‚Äôs thesis! In the Department of Chemical Engineering in the group of Connor W. Coley, I am working on structure elucidation of mass spectra using neural networks. I am supported by the Zeno Karl Schindler Master‚Äôs Thesis Grant and the Swiss European Mobility Programme.
[24/03] I started working as a research intern in the Laboratory of Artificial Chemical Intelligence (LIAC) at EPFL! I will be working with Philippe Schwaller and Andres M. Bran on large language model agents in heterogeneous catalysis. Our work won a poster award at the Faraday Discussions in data-driven discovery in the chemical sciences in Oxford, UK.
[23/09] I am starting my master‚Äôs studies in chemistry at ETH Zurich, supported by the Excellence Scholarship and Opportunity Program (ESOP) by the ETH Foundation.

[2024] Feature Frau des Monats, M√§rz 2024 (DE). Woman of the month, March 2024, at my former high school. Highlighting young women in STEM, initiated by my high school, Wiedner Gymnasium ‚Äì Sir Karl Popper Schule

I am giving detailed insights into everyday school life at the Sir Karl Popper Schule, tells what makes it a special school for me and reveal why the best gingerbread spice recipe has something to do with science!

[2018] Feature of the winning teams of the European Science Olympiad 2018 I am beyond proud and excited for our team! 


Chemical Education
A recent passion project of mine is combining chemical education with digital chemistry. I‚Äôve started a blog called ByteSizedChem ‚Äì it‚Äôs a work in progress ‚Äì to share my findings and tips for new students getting started in this exciting field. Feedback always welcome!

By The Way
A recent passion project of mine is combining chemical education with digital chemistry. I‚Äôve started a blog called ByteSizedChem ‚Äì it‚Äôs a work in progress ‚Äì to share my findings and tips for new students getting started in this exciting field. Feedback always welcome!
